title: First Look Teaser for Netflix's 'Fear Street: Prom Queen' Horror Sequel
description: "Save the date for one killer night." Netflix has unveiled a first look teaser along with a final release date for the next offering in this horror franchise - Fear Street: Prom Queen. This is the fourth installment so far, following up the original three films. Netflix launched the Fear Street series, adapted from R. L. Stine's horror books, with the interconnected Fear Street Part One: 1994, Fear Street Part Two: 1978, Fear Street Part Three: 1666. They all debuted in the summer of 2021, so we've been waiting for a follow-up for 4 years. In this new Fear Street movie, prom season at Shadyside High is underway and the school's It Girls are busy with campaigns for the crown. When an outsider puts herself in the running, then girls star disappearing, the class of '88 is in for one hell of a prom night. Starring India Fowler, Suzanna Son, Fina Strazza, Chris Klein, David Iacono, Ella Rubin, Ariana Greenblatt, along with Lily Taylor and Katherine Waterson. There is actually a single new book this is based on. Stay tuned for updates before the release in May. This teaser uses the phrase "a new era" which means there might be [â€¦]
author: Alex Billington

text: TRAILERS by February 25, 2025Source: YouTube "Save the date for one killer night." Netflix has unveiled a first look teaser along with a final release date for the next offering in this horror franchise - Fear Street: Prom Queen. This is the fourth installment so far, following up the original three films. Netflix launched the Fear Street series, adapted from R. L. Stine's horror books, with the interconnected Fear Street Part One: 1994, Fear Street Part Two: 1978, Fear Street Part Three: 1666. They all debuted in the summer of 2021, so we've been waiting for a follow-up for 4 years. In this new Fear Street movie, prom season at Shadyside High is underway and the school's It Girls are busy with campaigns for the crown. When an outsider puts herself in the running, then girls star disappearing, the class of '88 is in for one hell of a prom night. Starring India Fowler, Suzanna Son, Fina Strazza, Chris Klein, David Iacono, Ella Rubin, Ariana Greenblatt, along with Lily Taylor and Katherine Waterson. There is actually a single new book this is based on. Stay tuned for updates before the release in May. This teaser uses the phrase "a new era" which means there might be even more films in play after this. Here's the initial announcement teaser for Matt Palmer's horror Fear Street: Prom Queen, via YouTube: Welcome back to Shadyside. In this next installment of the blood-soaked Fear Street series from Netflix, prom season at Shadyside High is underway and the school's wolfpack of It Girls is busy with its usual sweet and vicious campaigns for the crown. But when a gutsy outsider puts herself in the running, and the other girls start mysteriously disappearing, the class of '88 is suddenly in for one hell of a prom night. Fear Street: Prom Queen is directed by genre filmmaker Matt Palmer, of the thriller film Calibre (2018) previously, plus many other shorts. The screenplay is written by Matt Palmer & Donald Mcleary. Produced by Peter Chernin, Jenno Topping, and Kori Adelson for Chernin Entertainment. Based on the book series created by R.L. Stine. Executive produced by Yvonne Bernard, Joan Waricha, Jane Stine. Netflix will release Palmer's Fear Street: Prom Queen movie available on Netflix worldwide starting May 23rd, 2025. Ready? Find more posts in: Horror, Streaming, To Watch, Trailer prev next
html:
TRAILERS

by
February 25, 2025
Source: YouTube

"Save the date for one killer night." Netflix has unveiled a first look teaser along with a final release date for the next offering in this horror franchise - Fear Street: Prom Queen. This is the fourth installment so far, following up the original three films. Netflix launched the Fear Street series, adapted from R. L. Stine's horror books, with the interconnected Fear Street Part One: 1994, Fear Street Part Two: 1978, Fear Street Part Three: 1666. They all debuted in the summer of 2021, so we've been waiting for a follow-up for 4 years. In this new Fear Street movie, prom season at Shadyside High is underway and the school's It Girls are busy with campaigns for the crown. When an outsider puts herself in the running, then girls star disappearing, the class of '88 is in for one hell of a prom night. Starring India Fowler, Suzanna Son, Fina Strazza, Chris Klein, David Iacono, Ella Rubin, Ariana Greenblatt, along with Lily Taylor and Katherine Waterson. There is actually a single new book this is based on. Stay tuned for updates before the release in May. This teaser uses the phrase "a new era" which means there might be even more films in play after this.

Here's the initial announcement teaser for Matt Palmer's horror Fear Street: Prom Queen, via YouTube:

Welcome back to Shadyside. In this next installment of the blood-soaked Fear Street series from Netflix, prom season at Shadyside High is underway and the school's wolfpack of It Girls is busy with its usual sweet and vicious campaigns for the crown. But when a gutsy outsider puts herself in the running, and the other girls start mysteriously disappearing, the class of '88 is suddenly in for one hell of a prom night. Fear Street: Prom Queen is directed by genre filmmaker Matt Palmer, of the thriller film Calibre (2018) previously, plus many other shorts. The screenplay is written by Matt Palmer & Donald Mcleary. Produced by Peter Chernin, Jenno Topping, and Kori Adelson for Chernin Entertainment. Based on the book series created by R.L. Stine. Executive produced by Yvonne Bernard, Joan Waricha, Jane Stine. Netflix will release Palmer's Fear Street: Prom Queen movie available on Netflix worldwide starting May 23rd, 2025. Ready?

Find more posts in: Horror, Streaming, To Watch, Trailer
